xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 21 February 2014
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 01:25 <sdumitriu1> has quit 08:52 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 10:27 <Shubhamtomar> has quit 11:00 <akats2> has joined #phenotips 11:09 <kushalk124> has quit 11:12 <sdumitriu1> has quit 11:25 <kushalk124> has quit 11:41 <Shubhamtomar> has quit 12:24 <akats2> do you need spelling corrector functionality too? 12:26 <akats2> and also do you want to limit the number of results given out to 10? 12:30 <sdumitriu> Spelling would be great 12:30 <sdumitriu> I'm not sure it's a must, but it would be nice to have it 12:31 <sdumitriu> The way we do for HPO is to use different boosts for different fields 12:31 <sdumitriu> 10 results should be enough, the user should type more to get different results 12:32 <akats2> Am I supposed to see it in the xml response or is it only gotten through response.getSpellCheckResponse() ? 12:32 <sdumitriu> It should be in the XML if you ask for it 12:32 <sdumitriu> You need two more parameters 12:33 <sdumitriu> Check what the abstract solr ontology does when building the query 12:34 <akats2> gotcha 13:05 <akats2> I just found a bug in gitHub 13:05 <akats2> I'll show you later 14:27 <akats> has joined #phenotips 14:42 <akats> Might have found a very low priority bug in Phenotips 14:45 <sdumitriu> Which one? 14:47 <akats> Make new patient record, create new measurement, enter nothing, cancel edit 14:48 <akats> Also, """ Currently terms such as macrocephaly and growth terms are auto-populated from the prenatal measurements and the clinical synopsis measurements fields. """. I can't get it to do this. 14:58 <akats> Sergiu, I know exactly what we'll have them do! We'll have them write tests! Lots and lots of tests. 14:59 <sdumitriu> Do you think that's gonna be pleasant for them? 15:01 <akats> No. Not at all. Is it supposed to be? 15:01 <sdumitriu> Yes, a bit 15:01 <akats> Oh, I see 15:01 <sdumitriu> We're also competing with other famous organizations to get the best students 15:02 <akats> What kind of students are they. Highschool or Undergrad? 15:02 <sdumitriu> Undergrad -> PostDocs 15:02 <sdumitriu> Mostly undergrads and masters 15:03 <akats> Wow. 15:03 <akats> Can we have them implement features? 15:03 <akats> new features that is 15:03 <sdumitriu> After they get accepted, yes 15:03 <sdumitriu> That's the goal 15:03 <sdumitriu> Small tasks are just in the beginning, to prove that they're worthy 15:04 <sdumitriu> The acceptance ratio is less than 20% 15:05 <akats> How can that be? They are professional programmers 15:14 <akats> This is odd. I built master. But the only thing that gets selected automatically is "Stature for age". "Weight" and "Head circumference" are both not being selected. 15:25 <akats> So this is a solid bug that I found. There are several ways to trigger it. 17:59 <akats> So it appears that right now the whole automatic selection process is meant to be used only with "extreme-". All of the hooks that I've seen are only "extreme-" and more importantly the unselection process works only with "extreme-" 18:00 <akats> So really the easy fix would be a one way street to "above-norm" and "below-norm". But you said that some definitions are based on percentiles and some on S.D. 18:03 <sdumitriu> Hm, indeed, they only work with extreme-* 18:03 <sdumitriu> I was pretty sure I saw one with below-normal a few days ago when looking at that code 18:04 <sdumitriu> But it should be easy to make the code work with both values 18:05 <akats> Um... is there a reason why the unselect is written as ['extreme-below-normal', 'extreme-above-normal'].without(values[p]['valCategory'] || '').each(function(val) 18:06 <sdumitriu> There's a reason for everything 18:06 <sdumitriu> Sometimes, Marta works in misterious ways... 18:08 <akats> Is it ok if I rewrite it? 18:08 <sdumitriu> Sure 18:08 <akats> ok 18:08 <akats> has quit 20:33 <allasm> has quit
